title: Bandipur National Park
short_description: A jewel of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve, famous for its large elephant and tiger populations.
long_description: Bandipur National Park, located in Karnataka, is one of India's most famous national parks and is part of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve. It was established in 1974 as a tiger reserve under Project Tiger. Together with the adjoining Nagarhole National Park, Mudumalai National Park, and Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary, it represents the largest protected area in Southern India and the largest habitat of wild elephants in South Asia. The park is characterized by deciduous forests rich in sandalwood and teak, and it offers great opportunities to see tigers, dholes (wild dogs), gaurs, and elephants in their natural habitat.
wildlife_significance: Key component of India's largest biosphere reserve. Holds a significant population of Asiatic Elephants and Tigers.
guides_and_tips: Private vehicles are not allowed inside. Use the government safari vans. Jeep safaris are limited.
how_to_reach: By Air: Mysore Airport (65 km) or Bangalore Airport (220 km). By Rail: Mysore is the nearest city (80 km).
permits_and_fees: Safari tickets can be booked online at Bandipur Tiger Reserve website or over the counter.
conservation_notes: Highway traffic ban at night (9 PM - 6 AM) strictly enforced to protect wildlife.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive at Jungle Lodge. Afternoon Safari. Evening wildlife film show. Day 2: Morning Safari. Breakfast. Check out. Drive to Himavad Gopalaswamy Betta for panoramic views. Departure.
safety_tips: Do not stop on the highway through the park. Speeding is punishable.

entry_fees.notes: Entry fee part of safari ticket.

operating_season.season_notes: Open year-round. Summer is best for elephant herds at waterholes.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Rates subject to revision by Karnataka Forest Department.
